intro: Euphrasia williamsii var. vestita, commonly known as the white-eyed toadflax, is a herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are square and erect. This variety is distinguished by its white petals and is often found in association with other members of the genus Euphrasia.
